items.label: lem-ito-correction-bound
items.title: Itô Correction Term Bound
items.content:
946: :label: lem-ito-correction-bound
947: 
948: For the kinetic SDE with adaptive diffusion (Definition [](#def-d-kinetic-operator-adaptive)), the Itô correction term in the drift is:
949: 
950: $$
951: b_{\text{correction}}(x, v, S) = \frac{1}{2}\sum_{j=1}^d \left( D_x \Sigma_{\text{reg}}^{(\cdot,j)}(x,S) \right) \Sigma_{\text{reg}}^{(\cdot,j)}(x,S)
952: $$
953: 
954: where $\Sigma_{\text{reg}}^{(\cdot,j)}$ is the $j$-th column of $\Sigma_{\text{reg}}$ and $D_x$ is the Jacobian with respect to $x$.
955: 
956: This term satisfies the bound:
957: 
958: $$
959: \|b_{\text{correction}}(x, v, S)\| \le C_{\text{Itô}} := \frac{1}{2} d \cdot \|\nabla_x \Sigma_{\text{reg}}\|_\infty \cdot c_{\max}^{1/2}
960: $$
961: 
962: where:
963: - $\|\nabla_x \Sigma_{\text{reg}}\|_\infty$ is the supremum of the operator norm of the Jacobian of $\Sigma_{\text{reg}}$ over the state space
964: - $c_{\max}^{1/2} = 1/\sqrt{\epsilon_\Sigma}$ is the upper bound on $\|\Sigma_{\text{reg}}\|_{\text{op}}$

items.label: lem-companion-flux-balance
items.title: Companion Flux Balance at QSD
items.content:
3832: :label: lem-companion-flux-balance
3833: 
3834: At the quasi-stationary distribution (QSD), the companion selection flux satisfies a geometric balance condition. For any walker $i$ in the alive set:
3835: 
3836: $$
3837: \sum_{j \in \mathcal{A}, j \neq i} P_{\text{comp}}(i|j; S) \cdot p_j(S) = p_i(S) \cdot \sqrt{\frac{\det g(x_i)}{\langle \det g \rangle}}
3838: $$
3839: 
3840: where:
3841: - $P_{\text{comp}}(i|j; S) \propto 1/d_{\text{alg}}(j,i)^{2+\nu}$ is the companion selection probability
3842: - $p_i(S) = \mathbb{E}_{c \sim P_{\text{comp}}}[\text{clip}(S_i(c)/p_{\max})]$ is the cloning probability
3843: - $g(x_i)$ is the emergent Riemannian metric at position $x_i$
3844: - $\langle \det g \rangle = \frac{1}{|\mathcal{A}|}\sum_{k \in \mathcal{A}} \sqrt{\det g(x_k)}$ is the mean metric determinant
3845: 
3846: **Physical interpretation**: The left side is the **rate at which walker $i$ is selected as a companion** by all other walkers. The right side is the **rate at which walker $i$ selects companions**, weighted by the local geometric volume factor $\sqrt{\det g(x_i)}$.

items.label: lem-velocity-marginalization
items.title: Fast Velocity Thermalization Justifies Annealed Approximation
items.content:
4091: :label: lem-velocity-marginalization
4092: 
4093: Consider the full Langevin dynamics on phase space $(x, v) \in \mathcal{X} \times \mathbb{R}^d$. Under the assumptions of geometric ergodicity (Chapter 4), there is a **timescale separation**:
4094: 
4095: $$
4096: \tau_v \ll \tau_x
4097: $$
4098: 
4099: where:
4100: - $\tau_v \sim \gamma^{-1}$: Velocity thermalization time
4101: - $\tau_x \sim \epsilon_c^{-2}$: Spatial exploration time (diffusion)
4102: 
4103: with $\epsilon_c = \sqrt{T/\gamma}$ the thermal coherence length.

items.label: lem-companion-bias-riemannian
items.title: Continuum Limit via Saddle-Point Approximation
items.content:
4145: :label: lem-companion-bias-riemannian
4146: 
4147: In the continuum limit $N \to \infty$ with the QSD spatial marginal given by Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-qsd-spatial-riemannian-volume`, the companion selection dynamics satisfy:
4148: 
4149: $$
4150: g(X) = \prod_{i=1}^N \sqrt{\det g(x_i)} \cdot \left(1 + O(1/\sqrt{N})\right)
4151: $$
4152: 
4153: where $g(x)$ is the Riemannian metric tensor on the state space.
4154: 
4155: **Consequence**: The corrected stationary distribution reduces to:
4156: 
4157: $$
4158: \pi'(X) = \frac{1}{Z'} \prod_{i=1}^N \left[\sqrt{\det g(x_i)} \exp\left(-\beta H_{\text{eff}}(x_i, v_i)\right)\right]
4159: $$
